snippet: Miners exposed to high levels of diesel exhaust have three to five times the risks of lung cancer as workers in occupations where diesel exhaust exposures are less intense, according to a study.
abstract: Government study finds that miners exposed to high levels of diesel exhaust have three to five times the risks of lung cancer as workers in occupations where diesel exhaust exposures are less intense; study will be published on the Web site of the Journal of the National Cancer Institute.
lead_paragraph: Miners exposed to high levels of diesel exhaust have three to five times the risks of lung cancer as workers in occupations where diesel exhaust exposures are less intense, according to a study.

headline.main: Study Shows Danger of Diesel Exhaust
headline.print_headline: Study Shows Danger of Diesel Exhaust

keywords.value: National Institute for Occupational Safety and Health
keywords.name: organizations
